    Author:

      static int checkedReadNextUnsignedByte(InputStream in)

    • Method Detail

      • checkedReadNextUnsignedByte

        @NotFullyTested
public static int checkedReadNextUnsignedByte(InputStream in)
                                       throws IOException
        Calls InputStream.read() and checks the result has range: [-1, 255]. At first glance, this method appears nearly useless, save for the fact that the valid range of values from method InputStream.read() cannot be guaranteed by the interface InputStream.

        Most primitive types in Java are signed (except char). The range for byte is -128 to 127. This method returns an unsigned byte stored in a signed integer type. Be careful when casting between byte and integer. For example, if this method returns 255, casting to byte will have value -128. If then cast to an integer, the value will by -128, not 255.

        Parameters:
        in - stream handle from which to read the next byte
        Returns:
        the next byte of data, or -1 if the end of the stream is reached
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if in is null
        IOException - if any I/O error occurs
        See Also:
        InputStream.read()
